learning_outcomes.description: Define, illustrate and critically analyse the cognitive, behavioural and cultural theories that inform an understanding of consumer behaviour.

Appreciate and evaluate the range of theories that can be applied to understanding aspects of consumers values, personality, learning, buying decision-making, gender, lifestyles, social class and consumption culture.

Complete a research project that demonstrates creativity and an ability to apply theory, and present research that informs a contemporary understanding of consumer behaviour relevant to marketing management.
Demonstrate effective communication abilities in making consumer and marketing decisions.

assessments.task_description:
In this individual assessment, students will assume the role of a marketer seeking to influence a specific consumer behaviour. They will draw on consumer behaviour theory and academic literature to explain why the selected behaviour occurs and to propose evidence-based, actionable strategies to influence it. 

This assessment will be submitted as an A3-sized poster/page. Students are required to submit a soft copy of their posters by the due date and display and present them to peers during Teaching Week 7 tutorials (Tutorial 6). Complete details will be provided in lectures and tutorials.

To complete this assessment, students will be required to undertake the following tasks:

  1. Identify and describe a specific consumer behaviour a student aims to influence as a marketer (e.g., safe driving, reducing overconsumption).
  2. Explain why consumers engage in this behaviour, drawing on academic literature to demonstrate an informed understanding of the psychological, social, or cultural drivers of the behaviour. (Primary data collection is not required.)
  3. Apply at least two relevant consumer behaviour concepts or theories covered in this course to explain or influence the behaviour. Additional theories may be used if relevant.
  4. Propose 2–3 actionable, theory-driven strategies that marketers could use to influence the selected behaviour.
  5. Briefly describe possible business, social and policy implications resulting from a change in this behaviour.

AI Statement:

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Your poster is to be submitted to Blackboard either on or before the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This assessment is a group project (5 students per group). In this assessment, students will conduct research on a chosen consumer behaviour phenomenon and prepare a report. Students will be required to do the following tasks for this assignment:

  1. Choose a topic that one of the group members selected for Assessment 1 or choose a completely new topic. 
  2. Conduct research to understand the selected consumer behaviour topic and identify and justify three research questions related to the selected topic that the group aims to answer.
  3. Prepare a research design to conduct interviews.
  4. Analyse and report the results of research.
  5. Provide a critical discussion of research findings by integrating at least one concept/theory for each research question. 
  6. Provide practical implications of research.

Peer Review: Group members are expected to contribute equally and fulfil the agreed tasks. If disagreements regarding team members' contributions cannot be resolved, students must bring the issue to the attention of their Course Coordinator as early as possible. All students will be required to undertake a Peer Review process, which can influence the marks of those who do not contribute to group work.

AI Statement:

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The report is to be submitted to Ultra Blackboard either on or before the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This assessment is a closed-book examination conducted during the end-of-semester examination period. The exam will comprise multiple-choice questions and short-answer questions, designed to assess students’ understanding and application of key consumer behaviour concepts covered in the course. Further information about the exam format will be provided on the course Blackboard site and in class towards the end of the semester.

AI Statement

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
